title: INFLUENCE OF DRUG-POLYMER INTERACTIONS ON RELEASE KINETICS OF PLGA AND PLA/PEG NPS

authors.name: Maria M. Perez Madrigal
affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

summary:
Here is a 2-sentence summary of the research:

The study investigates the influence of drug-polymer interactions on release kinetics of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and poly(lactic acid)-polyethylene glycol (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles (NPs) for antimicrobial resistance (AMR) treatment. The researchers aim to develop novel drug delivery systems using microfluidic-based synthesis of nano-sized carriers for improved encapsulation efficiency and controlled release kinetics.
methods:
• Microfluidic-based synthesis of nano-sized carriers for drug delivery systems (NDDS) was used to produce PLGA and PLA/PEG nanoparticles.
• Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) was studied as a global health threat.
• Novel drug delivery strategies were explored.
• Encapsulation efficiency was improved through precise control over nanocarrier characteristics.
results:
Here are the main research findings:

* Release kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PEG NPs were influenced by drug-polymer interactions.
* No specific numbers or measurements mentioned in the provided text.
